intro: Sphenogyne adonidifolia, commonly known as the alpine snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cold, mountainous environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery down, while its flowers are pale blue or white. Sphenogyne adonidifolia is adapted to harsh alpine conditions, making it a resilient and specialized species.
